Sentencas: A family of sealant materials has been developed for use in the solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) and in other applications in the temperature range of 800-1000 degrees C. These materials are based on glasses and glass-ceramics in the SrO-La2O3-Al2O3-B2O3-SiO2 system.
Titulo: Glass-ceramic sealants for solid oxide fuel cells .1. Physical properties

Sentencas: The coefficients of thermal expansion (CTE) for these materials are in the range of 8-13 x 10(-6)/degrees C, a good match with those of the SOFC components.
Titulo: Glass-ceramic sealants for solid oxide fuel cells .1. Physical properties

Sentencas: These sealant materials bond well with the ceramics of the SOFC and, more importantly, form bonds that can be thermally cycled without failure.
Titulo: Glass-ceramic sealants for solid oxide fuel cells .1. Physical properties

Sentencas: At the fuel cell operating temperature, the sealants have viscosities in the range of 10(4)-10(6)
Titulo: Glass-ceramic sealants for solid oxide fuel cells .1. Physical properties

Sentencas: Pa-s, which allow them to tolerate a CTE mismatch of about 20% among the bonded substrates.
Titulo: Glass-ceramic sealants for solid oxide fuel cells .1. Physical properties

Sentencas: The gas tightness of a sample seal was demonstrated in a simple zirconia-based oxygen concentration cell.
Titulo: Glass-ceramic sealants for solid oxide fuel cells .1. Physical properties
